page.title: 06Beswick & Watton C.E. School
page.content: This is the local Primary School, serving the communities of Beswick, Watton and Kilnwick, and nearby farmsteads such as Bracken. It is a Church of England school, controlled by Humberside Education Authority. Built in the 1850's through the Hotham family, the school buildings comprise one large classroom which also serves as hall and dining-room, one small room, two entrance porches and a small scullery. There are indoor toilets for boys, girls and staff. A range of outbuildings include outdoor toilets, caretaker's store and two former coke stores which are now storage sheds. A wooden hut houses P.E. equipment. There are two small yards, a large playground and a sports field. The nearby School House, intended as the Head Teacher's residence, is presently occupied by a LEA officer.
